p: Estragole is a natural oil constituent in several species. Studies using oral, intraperitoneal, or subcutaneous administration of this constituent reported carcinogenic effects in mice, with controversial results reported for its mutagenicity [ 22]. In fact, metabolites of estragole are considered stronger hepatocarcinogens due to the formation of hepatic DNA adducts in vivo and in vitro [ 23]. An absence of this toxic constituent in Mexican species is important to mention because of the frequent medicinal use of the plant for several ailments [ 6].
